head.title: Spinning the Washing Into a 'Family Sport'

hedline.hl1: Spinning the Washing Into a 'Family Sport'

abstract.p: Clean Rite Laundry, with 218 washers and dryers and family-oriented amenities, opens on Brooklyn's Eastern Parkway near Atlantic Avenue; logo (New Yorkers & Co column) (S)

block.p: The newest Clean Rite laundry, a 10,000-square-foot space on Eastern Parkway near Atlantic Avenue in East New York, Brooklyn, is not a classic mom-and-pop laundry. But the store, with 218 washers and dryers, is aimed at moms and pops: there is a CD-filled jukebox and a children's area with DVD movies, videos and board games. John Sabino, the company's president, describes the 24-hour laundry as ''a family sport.'' With this, the company's 37th location, it hopes to brighten a block that now contains many boarded-up buildings and vacant lots.
''We're an economic engine,'' says Tim King, director of real estate.
